channel.title: Report on Liz's Section
channel.description: Recent content in Report on Liz's Section

item.title: Weekly Report 7
item.description:
[Update]

This is the week between 11/25-12/1.

At Tuesday, I finished Module5 of the Course. And I’m decide to keep this trend to finish this course within this week.

At Wednesday, I do finish this course PART I as mentioned.

I decide that I skip the exercises of LADR and just focus on reading the main chapters of this book from Chapter5 Section 5B, since I feel like needing time to digest and convince myself about these theorems.

[Online Course]

1. Mathematics for Computer Science

Reference:

Course | 6.042J | 2019 Fall | MIT Open Learning Library

【麻省理工-离散数学 | 2010 Fall】（中英字幕）_哔哩哔哩_bilibili

Time line:

  • Start: 2024/10
  • To date: Unit1 Proofs

Course | 6.042J | 2019 Fall | MIT Open Learning Library

【麻省理工-离散数学 | 2010 Fall】（中英字幕）_哔哩哔哩_bilibili

Review:

2.From Nand to Tetris (PARTI & PARTII)

Reference:

Coursera | Online Courses From Top Universities. Join for Free

Time line:

  • Start: 2024/11
  • Module1 Boolean Functions & Logic Gates, 2024/11/10 [End]
  • Module2 Boolean Arithmetic & ALU, 2024/11/13 [End]
  • Module3 Memory 2024/11/18 [Start]; 2024/11/19 [End]
  • Module4 Machine Code 2024/11/20 [Start]; 11/24 [End]
  • Module5 Computer Architecture 2024/11/24[Start]; 11/26[End]
  • Module6 Assembler 2024/11/27[Start]; 11/27[End]
  • Module7 Virtual Machine: Stack Arithmetic 2024/12/1[Start]

Review:

[Books]

1. Discrete Mathematics and its applications, 8th edition, Kenneth H. Rosen

Reference:

Time Line:

  • Start: 2024/10
  • Ch1 The Foundation: Logic & Proofs, 2024/11/08[End]
  • Ch2 Basic Structures: Sets,Functions, Sequences, Sums and Matrices, 2024/11/25[End]
  • Ch3 Algorithms

Review:

One of the best book at an introductory level for computer science students. There are many examples to make sure the reader understand the content of the text.

2. Linear Algebra Done Right, 4th Edition, Sheldon Axler

Reference:

https://linear.axler.net/

Time Line:

  • Start: 2024/09
  • Chapter4 Polynomials, 11/11[finished]
  • Chapter5 Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors, 11/12[Start];
    • Section5A, 11/28[End]
    • Section5B 12/1[End]
    • Section5C 12/1[Begin]

Review:

One of the best books at an introductory level for mathematic-major students.

item.title: Yearly Report 2024
item.description:
[Online Course]

1. Crash Course on Computer Science

Reference:

https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1EW411u7th?p=1&vd_source=eb54fab8ff9874cf7378b4cfd5ece052

Time line:

  • Strat Date: 2024/09
  • End Date: 2024/09

Review:

This course is about 40+ Hours but cover a large variety of topics (almost all!) in computer science, including the history of primitive computing machines and modern computers; the hardware, form vacuum tubes to semiconductors, and software of computer; the major disciplines of computer science, such as complexity, database, net, cryptology, computer version, graphics and so on. Though I didn’t fully understanding every episode it offered, this give a comprehensive understanding of what computer science is and how it studies.

2.Information Theory and Entropy

Reference:

Information and Entropy | Information and Entropy | Electrical Engineering and Computer Science | MIT OpenCourseWare

Time Line:

  • Start: 2024/09
  • Pause:2024/10, finished 5 chapters/ 9 chapters.

Review:

I finished the first four chapters on the theorems of information, encoding, compression, error correction and probability. However, because this course was uploaded a very long time ago(about nearly 10 years!), the quality of the video isn’t very clear, and there is no blogs communicating on this course, so I often felt helpless when I encounter some puzzles. But I still think this course is worth learning.

3. Missing Semester on your Computer Science Education

Reference:

MIT - the missing semester of your cs education (missing-semester-cn.github.io)

[Bash引用手册] Quoting (Bash Reference Manual) (gnu.org)

Time line:

  • Start Date:2024/10
  • Pause: From 2024/10, because it is too hard and require many pre-knowledge.

Review:

This course mainly focuses on some useful tools based on command lines, most of which rely on a language like Unix or Bash(I don’t have many knowledge in this terminology). I think this course is worth studying because you will encounter many situations where dealing with command lines is a mandatory. For example, I use Hugo to update my personal site, and it requires some command language just like Bash I learned in this course. However, this course requires much pre-knowledge than I expected, so I stop learning after two or three lectures. Maybe I will continue later in this year?

4. Mathematics for Computer Science

Reference:

Course | 6.042J | 2019 Fall | MIT Open Learning Library

【麻省理工-离散数学 | 2010 Fall】（中英字幕）_哔哩哔哩_bilibili

Time line:

  • Start: 2024/10
  • To date: Unit1 Proofs

Course | 6.042J | 2019 Fall | MIT Open Learning Library

【麻省理工-离散数学 | 2010 Fall】（中英字幕）_哔哩哔哩_bilibili

Review:

5.From Nand to Tetris

Reference:

Coursera | Online Courses From Top Universities. Join for Free

Time line:

  • Start: 2024/10
  • Module1 Boolean Functions & Logic Gates, 2024/11/10
  • Module2 Boolean Arithmetic & ALU, 2024/11/13

Review:

[Books]

1. Discrete Mathematics and its applications, 8th edition, Kenneth H. Rosen

Reference:

Time Line:

  • Start: 2024/10
  • Ch1 The Foundation: Logic & Proofs, 2024/11/08

Review:

One of the best book at an introductory level for computer science students. There are many examples to make sure the reader understand the content of the text.

2. Linear Algebra Done Right, 4th Edition, Sheldon Axler

Reference:

https://linear.axler.net/

Time Line:

  • Start: 2024/09
  • Chapter4 Polynomials finished, 11/11

Review:

One of the best books at an introductory level for mathematic-major students.

item.title: Weekly Report 6
item.description:
[Update]

During the most of this week, I am building the foundation of logic and mathematics. To be precise, I read some books about logic and axiomatic set theory, e.g. Jech. Then I placed and simplified some of the knowledge to form a practical system for me to master in a markdown file. The process has lasted for about 4-5 days, i.e. I start from Tuesday to Saturday. I barely do other things during this time.

[Online Course]

1. Mathematics for Computer Science

Reference:

Course | 6.042J | 2019 Fall | MIT Open Learning Library

【麻省理工-离散数学 | 2010 Fall】（中英字幕）_哔哩哔哩_bilibili

Time line:

  • Start: 2024/10
  • To date: Unit1 Proofs

【麻省理工-离散数学 | 2010 Fall】（中英字幕）_哔哩哔哩_bilibili

2.From Nand to Tetris

Coursera | Online Courses From Top Universities. Join for Free

Time line:

  • Start: 2024/11
  • Module1 Boolean Functions & Logic Gates, 2024/11/10 [End]
  • Module2 Boolean Arithmetic & ALU, 2024/11/13 [End]
  • Module3 Memory 2024/11/18 [Start]; 2024/11/19 [End]
  • Module4 Machine Code 2024/11/20 [Start]; 11/24 [End]

Review:

[Books]

1. Discrete Mathematics and its applications, 8th edition, Kenneth H. Rosen

Reference:

Time Line:

  • Start: 2024/10
  • Ch1 The Foundation: Logic & Proofs, 2024/11/08

Review:

One of the best book at an introductory level for computer science students. There are many examples to make sure the reader understand the content of the text.

2. Linear Algebra Done Right, 4th Edition, Sheldon Axler

Reference:

https://linear.axler.net/

Time Line:

  • Start: 2024/09
  • Chapter4 Polynomials [finished], 11/11
  • Chapter5 Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors 11/12 [Start];

Review:

One of the best books at an introductory level for mathematic-major students.

item.title: Weekly Report 5
item.description:
So far, it’s time to establish my English channel! To date I decide to only upload some study report, usually very neat. So let’s begin!

In the past three months, I actually have studies a lot of stuff, thanks to the fact that there is only 2 credits chosen this semester. So in general, I learned Some courses and books:

[Current Online Course]

1. Crash Course on Computer Science

Reference:

https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1EW411u7th?p=1&vd_source=eb54fab8ff9874cf7378b4cfd5ece052

Time line:

  • Strat Date: 2024/09
  • End Date: 2024/09

Though I didn’t fully understanding every episode it offered, this give a comprehensive understanding of what computer science is and how it studies.
